note.p: Death: A hackney coach in London (04 January 1692)
Education: St Catharine's College, Cambridge; MD (Lit. Reg. 1671)
Career: Practised in London; strangled in a Hackney carriage by Henry Harrison, a swindler, to whose mistress he had lent money; Harrison was convicted of the murder and hanged on 15 Apr 1692.
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Munk's Roll; Venn; Hunter
References: John H Appleby, 'Ginseng and the Royal Society' in NR 1982-83 vol 37 pp 121-145
